    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    ActiveActor
    The ActiveActor class serves as a base class for all active game entities.
    ActiveActorDestructible
    Represents an active actor in the game that can be destroyed.
    Boss
    Represents a Boss character in the game with unique abilities and behaviors such as a shield, a health bar, and complex movement patterns.
    BossProjectile
    Represents a projectile fired by the Boss character in the game.
    Controller
    The Controller class manages the flow of the game, including level transitions and error handling.
    Destructible
    Represents an object that can take damage and be destroyed.
    EnemyPlane
    Represents an enemy plane in the game.
    EnemyProjectile
    Represents a projectile fired by an enemy in the game.
    FighterPlane
    Abstract class representing a FighterPlane.
    GameOverImage
    Represents the game over screen displayed when the player loses the game.
    GameWindow
    Represents the main game window for the "Sky Battle" game.
    Heart
    Represents a heart in the game, which can act as a health indicator or a collectible item.
    HeartDisplay
    Manages the display of hearts in the game, allowing for dynamic addition and removal of hearts.
    LevelOne
    Represents the first level of the game.
    LevelParent
    Abstract base class for all game levels.
    LevelThree
    Represents the third level of the game.
    LevelTwo
    Represents the second level of the game.
    LevelView
    Represents the view layer of a level, managing the UI elements such as hearts, win image, and game over image.
    LevelViewLevelTwo
    Represents the view layer for Level Two, extending the base LevelView.
    Main
    The Main class serves as the entry point for the Sky Battle game application.
    MainMenu
    Represents the main menu of the game, providing options to start the game, access settings, and exit the game.
    MusicPlayer
    The MusicPlayer class is a singleton utility for managing background music and sound effects in a game or application.
    MutationBoss1
    Represents the first mutation of the Boss enemy in the game.
    Projectile
    Abstract class representing a Projectile.
    ShieldImage
    Represents the shield image used in the game, allowing it to be shown or hidden as needed.
    UserPlane
    Represents the user's controllable plane in the game.
    UserProjectile
    Represents a projectile fired by the user-controlled plane.
    WinImage
    Represents the "You Win" screen in the game, which displays a congratulatory image and an exit button.
